mainmatter.p: Let L be a complete lattice and F : L \to L a monotone map. Then the set \alpha \vcentcolon \equiv \bigvee \left \{ x \in L \mid x \le F(x) \right \} is a fixed point of F.

block.headline: Proof.
block.p: We first define the abbreviation H \vcentcolon \equiv \{ x \in L \mid x \le F( x ) \}.

To show F( \alpha ) = \alpha, we use antisymmetry. For the ( \ge ) direction, it suffices to show F( \alpha ) is an upper bound of H. Let x \in H. We know x \le \alpha as \alpha is the least upper bound of H which implies F(x) \le F( \alpha ). We also know x \le F(x) by the definition of H which means x \le F(x) \le F( \alpha ). For the ( \le ) direction, notice that we know F( \alpha ) \le F(F( \alpha )) by the fact we just showed which means F( \alpha ) \in H. It follows that F( \alpha ) \le \alpha since \alpha is the least upper bound of H.

frontmatter.title: Pointed dcpo fixed point theorem III

mainmatter.p: Let (D, \sqsubseteq ) be a pointed dcpo and F : D \to D an inflationary endomap on it. There exists a least fixed point for function F.
Let L be a complete lattice and F : L \to L a monotone map. Then the set \alpha \vcentcolon \equiv \bigvee \left \{ x \in L \mid x \le F(x) \right \} is a fixed point of F.

block.p: We first define the abbreviation H \vcentcolon \equiv \{ x \in L \mid x \le F( x ) \}.

For the ( \le ) direction, notice that we know F( \alpha ) \le F(F( \alpha )) by the fact we just showed which means F( \alpha ) \in H.
